temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.search
Class DFS

java.lang.Object
  temp.fibHeap.stixar.graph.search.DFS
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Algorithm, Filtering
public class DFS
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algorithm, Filtering

Filtering depth first search algorithm. Depth first search makes use of a visitor object whose methods are invoked throughout the search. The visitor has methods indicating the various contexts which can occur during the search and can be used to construct many different algorithms.

Constructor Detail

DFS

public DFS(Graph graph,
           DFS.Visitor vis)
Construct a DFS algorithm from a graph and a DFS visitor. The default is to use the nonrecursive implementation.

DFS

public DFS(Graph graph,
           DFS.Visitor vis,
           boolean recursive)
Construct a DFS algorithm from a graph and a DFS visitor, specifying whether or not to use the non recursive implementation.

If the non recursive implementation is used, then an explicit stack will be created rather than using the implicit call stack in the recursive style. As the JVM has a limit on the depth call stack, this can limit the size of the graphs that can be handled. On the other hand, the non recursive version requires additional explicit storage (an array of size graph.nodeSize()). The default is to use the non recursive version.

Experiments comparing the speeds of the two implementations were inconclusive because there was too much variance. Sometimes either implementation was faster, depending on the calling context.

Parameters:
graph - a graph on which to perform DFS
vis - a visitor
recursive - whether or not to use an explicit stack.
